attributes.action: Offer MPs rooms in the Olympic Village after the 2012 Olympics in lieu of second home allowances.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Whilst acknowledging that MPs who live outside London need accommodation in London, the current 'second homes allowance' is being abused and is certainly not giving value for money to the taxpayer.

I therefore propose that all MPs be allocated two rooms each in the Olympic Village after the 2012 games have closed, one for use as a study and the other as a bedroom. 

The Olympic Village will have good transport links, catering facilities, gymnasiums and leisure facilities and established security procedures. 

Above all, this will end the mess that is the present system and provide value to the taxpayers who are funding the Olympic facilities through taxation and the plundering of the National Lottery fund.

rejection.details: Matters relating to MPs should be communicated directly with Parliament, and concerns about the Olympic Park should be addressed to the Olympic Delivery Authority.
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
